newsitem.title: USA: Camelot Corp to sell DigiPhone rights.
newsitem.headline: Camelot Corp to sell DigiPhone rights.

text.p: Camelot Corp said on Friday it would sell international rights to distribute DigiPhone Internet Telephony software to Meteor Technology plc for about $1.6 million in convertible stock.
In addition, Camelot would subscribe for another one million British pounds of loan stock for cash, it said.

Meteor, which already had the European distribution rights for DigiPhone, would acquire distribution rights for the rest of the world, excluding the United States and Canada, on November 22, the company said.
DigiPhone is a software program enabling voice communications over the Internet.

Camelot would receive about $1.6 million payable by the issuance of one million British pounds of 1996-2001 seven percent convertible loan stock, convertible into Meteor shares at 55 pence per share, the company said.
Upon conversion of all the stock, Camelot would own about 19 percent of the enlarged issued share capital of Meteor, the company said.
